__e: He loves his errant son,does he not? More than he loves his dutiful one.
If the Prodigal Son ticked you off, then you should just let him have it.

The stories are as old as time itself... the prodigal son who returns home to the father who forgives him... the jealous wife who tricks the husband who trust her... the desperate mother who risks everything for the child who needs her
This next one is for you, for all you lost souls racing down that long road to redemption, and all you sinners running from your past but heading straight into that pit of darkness up ahead.
She found two lost souls and turned us into a family.
If you take it and don't do something about it, then God damn your souls!
Or is it the prodigal daughter?
He needs a biological descendant to save his life-- a genetic donation from the woman he believes to be his long-lost daughter.
